item.title: 鲍威尔称需要更长时间才能获得对通胀的信心
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔表示，美联储可能需要比此前预期更长的时间才能对通胀轨迹获得足够的信心，从而开始降息。【原文：It will probably take longer than previously expected for the Federal Reserve to gain enough confidence about the inflation trajectory to start cutting interest rates, Chair Jerome Powell said.】

item.title: 美联储鹰派程度不及预期，国债延续涨势
item.description: 在美联储最新货币政策声明的基调不如许多投资者预期的鹰派之后，国债收益率下降，两年期国债收益率跌破 5%。【原文：Treasury yields declined, with the two-year note’s falling below 5%, after the tone of the Federal Reserve’s latest monetary policy statement was less hawkish than many investors expected.】

item.title: 美联储将从 6 月起放缓资产负债表的清算速度
item.description: 美联储表示，将从 6 月份开始放慢缩减资产负债表的速度，减少每月减持的债券数量。【原文：The Federal Reserve said it will shrink its balance sheet at a slower place beginning in June, reducing the amount of bond holdings it lets roll off every month.】

item.title: 美联储称通胀缺乏进展，维持利率不变
item.description: 美联储重申，在将利率从二十年来的高点下调之前，它需要更多的证据来证明物价上涨正在降温，这表明了对通货膨胀的新担忧。【原文：The Federal Reserve signaled fresh concerns about inflation as it reaffirmed it needs more evidence that price gains are cooling before cutting interest rates from a two-decade high.】

item.title: 纽约市推动贝莱德投资者投票反对阿美高管
item.description: 纽约市主计长布拉德-兰德（Brad Lander）敦促贝莱德公司股东投票反对沙特阿美首席执行官阿明-纳赛尔（Amin Nasser）当选公司董事会独立成员。【原文：New York City Comptroller Brad Lander is pressing BlackRock Inc. shareholders to vote against the election of Saudi Aramco Chief Executive Officer Amin Nasser as an independent member of the company’s board.】

item.title: 工人准备罢工对抗加拿大两大铁路巨头
item.description: 要求更多休息时间的铁路工人离罢工越来越近，罢工将中断从哈利法克斯到温哥华、从中西部到墨西哥湾的供应链。【原文：Rail workers demanding more rest time moved closer to a strike that would disrupt supply chains from Halifax to Vancouver and down through the Midwest to the Gulf of Mexico.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长德科斯越来越确信通胀率将很快降至 2
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员巴勃罗-埃尔南德斯-德-科斯（Pablo Hernandez de Cos）对欧元区通胀放缓至目标水平持乐观态度，这是官员们将于下月降息的最新信号。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Pablo Hernandez de Cos struck an optimistic tone on euro-area inflation slowing to target, the latest signal that officials will cut interest rates next month.】

item.title: 私募股权公司 Advent 探讨收购阿曼 OQ 化学公司的交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Advent International 正在与阿曼就向 OQ Chemicals 注入新资金以换取该公司多数股权的潜在行动进行谈判。【原文：Advent International is in talks with Oman about a potential move to inject fresh capital into OQ Chemicals in exchange for a majority stake in the company, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 邮轮公司维京号在美国首次公开募股 15 亿美元后股价上涨 12
item.description: 维京控股有限公司（Viking Holdings Ltd.）在扩大首次公开募股规模并募集 15.4 亿美元资金后的首个交易日中，股价攀升达 12%，这表明美国上市热潮继续扩大。【原文：Viking Holdings Ltd. shares climbed as much as 12% in the luxury cruise operator’s first trading session after an expanded initial public offering that raised $1.54 billion, a sign that the US listing revival continues to broaden.】

item.title: 巴里克首席执行官 "看不出有任何理由 "召开亲自出席的年会
item.description: 巴里克黄金公司（Barrick Gold Corp.）首席执行官表示，尽管人们呼吁上市公司恢复亲自出席的形式，但这家金矿公司仍将继续举办虚拟年度股东大会。【原文：Barrick Gold Corp.’s chief executive officer says the gold miner will continue to host virtual-only annual general meetings despite calls for public companies to return to an in-person format.】

item.title: 发行人需求超过对美联储的担忧，小额债券销售飙升
item.description: 2024 年前四个月，各州和市政府出售了 1 428 亿美元的长期市政债券，为近十年来最多，因为借贷需求超过了市场投资者对利率上升的担忧。【原文：States and municipalities sold $142.8 billion in long-term municipal bonds during the first four months of 2024, the most in almost a decade, as the need to borrow outweighed concerns over higher interest rates that afflicted investors in the market.】

item.title: 印度炼油巨头加入关键油价交易大军
item.description: 印度信实工业有限公司（Reliance Industries Ltd.）是全球最大炼油厂的所有者，它加入了越来越多的原油交易公司的行列，而原油是市场最重要的价格基准。【原文：India’s Reliance Industries Ltd., owner of the world’s largest oil refinery, joined a growing army of firms trading crude that underpins the market’s most important price benchmark, the latest sign of how the measure has been transformed by an infusion of US supply.】

item.title: 美联储已永久搁置，但仍无需担心
item.description: 在 FOMC 决策日，美国央行行长们的政策路径似乎已经被定价。由于债券损失可能受到限制，这甚至可能是一个买入机会。盈利报告显示，股市也不会承受过大的压力。当然，风险在于高于目标的通胀和更高更长的利率可能带来的压力。【原文：On FOMC decision day, it feels as if US central bankers’ policy path has already been priced in. With bond losses likely capped, this might even be a buying opportunity. Earnings reports show equities shouldn’t be under undue pressure, either. The risk, of course, lies in the potential pinch from above-target inflation — and higher-for-longer rates.】

item.title: 美国监管机构讨论最快于八月敲定银行资本规则
item.description: 美联储和其他美国最高监管机构正在推进其具有里程碑意义的计划，要求大银行持有更多资本，尽管一些批评者呼吁取消该计划。【原文：The Federal Reserve and other top US regulators are forging ahead with their landmark plan to make big banks hold more capital despite calls from some critics to scrap it.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会将于近日就埃克森-先锋公司 600 亿美元交易做出裁决
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美国联邦贸易委员会（Federal Trade Commission）将在未来几天内决定是否提起诉讼，阻止埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp.【原文：The Federal Trade Commission is set to decide whether to sue to block Exxon Mobil Corp.’s $60 billion acquisition of Pioneer Natural Resources Co. in coming days, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 为什么抵押贷款和利率是英国大选的热门话题？
item.description: 英国将于今年晚些时候举行大选，执政的保守党和反对党工党正在制定相互对立的计划，以帮助一个关键群体：有抱负的房主。几十年来，英国对住房投资不足，导致经济承受能力出现危机，而持续高企的利率又加剧了这一危机，借款人将房产再抵押贷款的成本不断攀升。住房成本上升的部分原因是前总理利兹-特拉斯（Liz Truss）时期的经济管理不善，以及保守党的经济政策。【原文：With Britain expecting a general election later this year, the ruling Conservatives and Labour opposition are drawing up rival plans to help a key demographic: aspiring homeowners. An affordability crisis caused by decades of underinvestment in housing is being compounded by persistently high interest rates, which are jacking up costs for borrowers when they remortgage their properties. Housing costs were inflated partly by economic mismanagement under former premier Liz Truss, and the Conservat】

item.title: 比特币 ETF 因折价创纪录而出现紧张迹象
item.description: 在加密货币跌至两个月低点后，现货比特币交易所交易基金出现了紧张迹象。【原文：Signs of stress are flashing across spot-Bitcoin exchange-traded funds after the cryptocurrency sank to a two-month low.】

item.title: 债券型共同基金敛财 1,080 亿美元，打破两年出逃潮
item.description: 固定收益共同基金正在做一件罕见的事：吸引新资金—并超越其节税型 ETF 同类产品。【原文：Fixed-income mutual funds are doing something rare: Attracting new money — and besting their tax-efficient ETF brethren.】

item.title: 美国酝酿首次绿色债券销售，开拓 26 亿美元市场
item.description: 美国财政部要求一个由证券交易商和投资者组成的咨询小组评估联邦政府是否应开始销售绿色债券，这可能会使美国更接近于加入其他国家的行列，这些国家一直在向专注于环保事业的基金推销其债务。【原文：The US Treasury asked an advisory group of securities dealers and investors to assess whether the federal government should start selling green bonds, potentially moving the US closer to joining other nations that have been marketing their debt to funds focused on evironmental causes.】

item.title: 欧佩克石油产量保持稳定，新减产计划尚未完成
item.description: 欧佩克（OPEC）上个月的原油产量保持稳定，因此该组织最新的减产计划尚未完成。【原文：OPEC’s crude production stayed steady last month, leaving the group’s latest cutbacks incomplete.】

item.title: 汇丰银行的凯特纳再次看到了 "金发姑娘"，因为收益率失去了重要性
item.description:
资本成本上升，他说，"因为增长确实不错"

。【原文：

The cost of capital is up, he says, ‘because growth is really good’

】

item.title: 肯尼亚目标将预算赤字降至 15 年来的最低点以增加收入
item.description: 在削减开支和积极征税的推动下，肯尼亚预计下一财政年度的预算赤字将创 15 年新低。【原文：Kenya projected a budget deficit for the coming financial year at a 15-year low, boosted by spending cuts and aggressive revenue collection.】

item.title: 比尔-黄受审：针对 Archegos 创始人的刑事案件解析
item.description: 黄成国（Sung Kook "Bill" Hwang）通过他的 "家族办公室 "Archegos Capital Management 管理自己的财富，在华尔街保持低调。但 2021 年 3 月，Archegos 突然倒闭，成为头条新闻，几乎抹去了 Hwang 360 亿美元的财富。这次倒闭也让公司的贷款人损失了 100 亿美元，导致瑞士信贷集团（Credit Suisse Group AG）倒闭。【原文：Sung Kook “Bill” Hwang maintained a low profile on Wall Street as he managed his own wealth through his “family office,” known as Archegos Capital Management. But then Archegos suddenly melted down in March 2021, making headlines and all but erasing Hwang’s $36 billion fortune. The collapse also cost the firm’s lenders $10 billion, contributing to the downfall of Credit Suisse Group AG.】

item.title: 挪威邮轮业绩下滑，上调后的盈利前景未能给人留下深刻印象
item.description: 挪威邮轮控股有限公司（Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd.）在行业繁荣导致出航需求创下新高的情况下，利润前景的改善辜负了投资者的厚望，公司股价暴跌。【原文：Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. plunged after its improved profit outlook disappointed investors’ high expectations amid an industry boom that’s caused record demand for sailings.】

item.title: 查尔斯-施瓦布捐赠者资助基金为莱昂纳多-利奥网络提供支持
item.description: 查尔斯-施瓦布公司（Charles Schwab & Co.【原文：Charles Schwab & Co.’s charitable fund has become a favorite vehicle for funding right-wing causes tied to influential conservative activist Leonard Leo.】

item.title: 盈利下降后橡树树削减私人信贷基金费用
item.description: 橡树资本管理公司（Oaktree Capital Management）将面向个人投资者的私人信贷基金的管理费削减了三分之一，原因是问题贷款增加，收益令人失望。【原文：Oaktree Capital Management cut management fees on a private credit fund aimed at individual investors by a third, following an increase in problem loans and disappointing earnings.】

item.title: 太平洋能源与 NextDecade 和 Tellurian 就美国液化天然气进行谈判
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，太平洋能源公司正在与Tellurian公司和NextDecade公司就美国墨西哥湾沿岸计划出口终端的天然气货物进行谈判。【原文：Pacific Energy is in talks with Tellurian Inc. and NextDecade Corp. for natural gas cargoes from planned export terminals along the US Gulf Coast, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 亿万富翁博洛雷考虑在法国建造电动汽车电池工厂
item.description: 亿万富翁文森特-博洛雷（Vincent Bollore）的同名控股公司正在考虑在法国东部建立一家电动汽车电池厂，在这位媒体和工业大亨对其帝国进行深入改革之际，这是一项耗资巨大的冒险。【原文：Billionaire Vincent Bollore’s eponymous holding company is considering building an electric-car battery factory in eastern France, a costly venture that comes amid a deep overhaul of the media and industry tycoon’s empire.】

item.title: 缉毒署行动引发 79% 的暴涨后，马铃薯股票空头遭到重创
item.description: 周二，美国缉毒署对大麻进行了重新分类，可能会消除大麻产业的一大障碍，大麻股因此大涨，而押注大麻股的交易商正面临巨大损失。【原文：Traders betting against marijuana stocks are facing massive losses after the shares surged Tuesday as the US Drug Enforcement Administration moved to reclassify the drug, potentially eliminating a major obstacle for the industry.】

item.title: 迪拜亿万富翁的子女计划重振陷入困境的世界群岛
item.description: 多年来，一个按照世界地图形状建造的人工群岛一直被视为迪拜濒临破产的象征。现在，一位亿万富翁开发商的子女正试图重振这一项目，他们将在这里建造起价 1360 万美元的海滨豪宅。【原文：For years, an artificial archipelago built in the shape of a world map was seen as a symbol of the excesses that brought Dubai to the brink of bankruptcy. Now, the children of a billionaire developer are seeking to revive the project with beachfront mansions starting at $13.6 million.】
